name: linux-filesystem
description: Enhanced filesystem access for Linux with support for symlinks, permissions, and Linux-specific features
long_description: A comprehensive MCP server providing secure filesystem operations on Linux with advanced features including symbolic link management, permission control via chmod, detailed file information (UID/GID, permissions), and directory access controls. Optimized specifically for Linux environments.

tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read file contents with Linux-specific features (symlink handling, permission checking)

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Write files with Linux permission preservation and symlink awareness

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create directories with Linux-specific permission control

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: List directory contents with detailed Linux metadata (permissions, ownership, symlinks)

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move/rename files while preserving Linux permissions and handling symlinks

tools.name: delete_file
tools.description: Safely delete files with Linux permission checks

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Get detailed Linux file metadata: UID/GID, permissions (octal/symbolic), file type, symlink target

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Search files with Linux-specific features: respect symlinks, hidden files, permissions

tools.name: create_symlink
tools.description: Create symbolic links (Linux-specific feature not available in other filesystem tools)

tools.name: read_symlink
tools.description: Read symlink targets (Linux-specific feature not available in other filesystem tools)

tools.name: chmod
tools.description: Change file/directory permissions using chmod (Linux-specific, not available in other tools)

allowed_directories.title: Allowed Directories
allowed_directories.description: Select directories the filesystem server can access
